attributes.action: Stop cash benefits to immigrants but give food tokens and clothing vouchers.
attributes.additional_details:
It is known that immigrants send British tax-payer money back to their families in their homelands.
It is not up to the British tax-payer to subsidise these people.
Benefits in monetary form should therefore be stopped and immigrants only entitled to the bare necessities to eat and clothe and this should be done in the form of vouchers and tokens.
attributes.background:
Currently immigrants receive benefits in monetary form when all they should receive is basic food and clothing.
The tax-payer should not be providing anything other than the basic needs so they can eat and clothe.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do as the term "immigrants" is very broad and many do not receive any benefits from the UK Government.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly who you would like this policy to apply to.
